name: NPR
text:
Phil Niekro, the National Baseball Hall of Famer and longtime pitcher for the Braves, has died at age 81.

From full-season debut in 1967 until his retirement in 1987, Niekro pitched 5,404 innings ‚Äî the most by any pitcher in the modern era.
https://t.co/5XSA0kRckP

name: NPR
text: #JustIn: President Trump has signed a coronavirus relief and spending package that he had threatened to derail. https://t.co/ZPErTyGpAM

name: NPR
text: RT @HorsleyScott: By signing the COVID relief bill and related spending package, Pres. Trump has averted a government shutdown. But his cliffhanger delay has already cost millions of jobless Americans a week of unemployment benefits. And it will cost millions more a week's $300 supplement.By signing the COVID relief bill and related spending package, Pres. Trump has averted a government shutdown. But h‚Ä¶ https://t.co/cxoWqBoUbi

name: NPR
text: The coronavirus relief package includes a fresh round of direct payments to qualifying Americans, worth up to $600 per adult and child; a boost in weekly unemployment benefits; and funds for small-business aid and vaccine distribution. https://t.co/LRbrhy20iN

name: NPR
text:
Guitarist Tony Rice ‚Äî who first gained attention as a member of J.D. Crowe's band, the New South, and was later inducted to the International Bluegrass Music Hall of Fame ‚Äî died on Christmas morning. He was 69.
https://t.co/opilkwPLvC

name: NPR
text:
Caleb Anderson was doing fractions when he was 2. He passed the first grade when he was 3. Now at 12, he's a sophomore in college. 

He wants to be an aerospace engineer. https://t.co/2uPNoLtRyB

name: NPR
text:
For the first time, archaeologists have excavated an entire, ancient food stall in Pompeii.

Some of what they found:

üèõ food remains ‚Äî like goat, fish and snails
üèõ paintings of animals
üèõ ceramic jars
üèõ wine flasks
üèõ water fountain
https://t.co/iUx7m9wIz3

name: NPR
text:
Polly Irungu wanted to spotlight and support Black women and nonbinary photographers, so she launched a community and database to do just that.

"What I want people to know about our community is that it has a depth of talent and untapped brilliance."
https://t.co/gMlXt64FWM

name: NPR
text:
He's from Malawi. She's from the Netherlands.

They fell in love working for a nonprofit. In March this year, he flew out to visit her and meet her family.

Then the pandemic hit ‚Äî and that hometown visit turned into a 7-month stay.
https://t.co/lEus4NwbAO

name: NPR
text:
The European Union began a mass vaccination campaign on Sunday to eventually inoculate 450 million people against COVID-19.
https://t.co/wwXWBDiqZg

name: NPR
text:
Indonesian cuisine isn't as widely known in the U.S. as other Asian foods, but Lara Lee is hoping to change that.

Her new cookbook, "Coconut & Sambal," aims to help make Indonesian dishes more accessible for more people.
https://t.co/DwgdWdGWlR

name: NPR
text:
Black residents helped settle Glencoe, Ill. But as home prices soared, few members of its historic Black church could afford to stay.

"When people would ask me, 'how long have you been in town?' ...  I was here first. You came to my town," a member says.
https://t.co/lAzs2Q6iFd

name: NPR
text: The path to the president signing the first major piece of pandemic relief legislation since the $2 trillion CARES Act in March was a long and circuitous one. https://t.co/6SLuqV8jYw

name: NPR
text: Even as COVID-19 vaccines roll out, several countries have announced some of the most severe lockdowns of the pandemic so far. https://t.co/EthRkzTbGN

name: NPR
text:
Chinese regulators have ordered Ant Group, the mobile payments company, to overhaul major aspects of its business ‚Äî a move that follows a scuttled IPO and comes just days after regulators announced an investigation of affiliate Alibaba.
https://t.co/EMijUclRqG

name: NPR
text:
Lin Qi, the 39-year-old billionaire CEO of video game developer Yoozoo Group, died on Christmas Day after falling sick and being hospitalized earlier this month.

Reports suggest he may have been poisoned by a colleague.
https://t.co/mrJqVqGafr

name: NPR
text: Several longtime anti-nuclear activists ‚Äî ranging in age from 58 to 81 ‚Äî have been sentenced to up to 33 months in prison after breaking into a naval base in Georgia in 2018. https://t.co/7YsT4D6Is8

name: NPR
text:
Loujain al-Hathloul, the activist who led the push to allow Saudi women to drive, has been sentenced to nearly 6 years in prison by the kingdom's terrorism court.

But she could be released in less than 3 months, her sister says.
https://t.co/sj8vTLRFeR

name: NPR
text:
Early in the pandemic, people were advised to disinfect everything they touched.

But now that scientists understand more about how COVID-19 spreads, it turns out all that scrubbing and wiping down might be overkill.
https://t.co/jnTR2Qp685

name: NPR
text:
In the U.S., incarcerated people are nearly 5 times as likely to test positive for coronavirus than the general public ‚Äî and nearly 3 times as likely to die.

But the question of when inmates will receive the vaccine is still wide open.
https://t.co/AUDllNKnTG

name: NPR
text: RT @OPB: Oregon State Police have made several arrests in connection with the far-right protest at the Oregon State Capitol last week. Among those arrested? A man accused of attacking two journalists covering the events. https://t.co/mzrUEqxqsy
